title: Is 'God Emperor of Dune (Dune Chronicles #4)' by Frank Herbert worth the read? - Quora

response.answer_text: Whats this crazy talk..’worth the read’…Is Return of the Jedi worth the watch, after the much more superiorly directed, and far less Ewok infested, Empire Strikes Back? Would you pass on the epic tale of the the normal, run-of-the-mill, nothing especially interesting twins Sandy and Dennys, couldnt think them siblings of the extraordinary Murry family until they are wisked away to a Dune like planet in ’Many Waters’ just because the story doesn't have the delicious plot device ‘A Swiftly Tilting ‘ planet does, with its ‘Might Have Been’ McGuffin at the heart of the adventure? ‘The Drawing of the Three” possibly the best in the ‘Dark Tower’ series…I am kinda beating this comparative loss retort into the ground a bit. Point obviously is, although superior stories have been told and seen from within that universe, there is still more fascination to be discovered. Of all the novels in the Dune Chronicles; Dune or Children of Dune Being arguably the best, God, Emperor of Dune is the one I puzzle on more and more often just because it is so off the written path of the other novels…it is a hard read at first, from my perspective, because the protagonist is a creature most would have as an antagonist. Maybe that was Herberts premise all the while…turning the hero trope around and having the reader see the story from the mind of the antagonist…Hmmm…been 20 years since I read that novel AND I STILL FIND REVELATIONS LIKE THIS ONE…I digress. Reading a book is like dancing, some stories I glide right into, flow off each other in a beautiful rythm, sometimes a story is like a bumbling staring at their feet, clumsy and awkward off beat, going back a few pages because I missed something, adventure in patience, like Tolkiens Silmarilian, yet, when the song is over, the adventure…are you happy with the time spent engaged with that world or dance partner for the duration of the song? Although God, ‘Emperor of Dune” was as anti-climatic as dancing with a very attractive 3rd cousin at a family wedding, it was still enjoyable and thought provoking epic time during. Duncan Idaho really gets his place in the limelight during this story, it is a shame such a unique character was killed off so early in Dune. Its worth the read just to see the Dune world 10,000 years after the events of Children of Dune, Duke Leto the second transformed after melding with the sand trout, becoming the monster to save humanity embarking on his Golden Path… It has been 20 years since I have read that novel and I was able to recall everything about it without need to refresh the old memory banks, that says quite a bit about that unique, sometimes awkward tale. Take the time, read this book.
